page.title: 18Ghosts:Chinnor and Sydenham
page.content: There are a number of tales of supernatural occurrences in our area. A young baby is believed to have died in an inn called 'The Bird in Hand' in Chinnor; the sound of its crying has been heard several times. Once the sound was so strong that the police were called, in the belief that there was a living child on the premises. These officers also heard the weeping but despite a thorough search no child was found. Two ghosts stalk Sydenham; one haunting Sewell's Lane-a track linking the village with the Lower Icknield Way. People occasionally experience 'a cold, ghostly feeling' on this lonely thoroughfare. The other ghost lurks at Stert crossroads where once a carriage overturned killing all who rode in it. Subsequently, suicides, fatalities etc have regularly occurred.
